description: White snakeroot (Ageratina altissima) is an amazing native wildflower species. It is known for its vigorous growth, and its thick cluster of tiny snowy-white floral heads. The mat forming herbaceous perennial stays evergreen, and can tolerate a variety of soil conditions and light levels. The flowers are visited by a variety of pollinators, and when the flowers are done, they are replaced by showy seed heads. The white snakeroot has a long history of medicinal use, and the root of the plant is said to have powerful healing properties. But moreover, its beauty and graceful structure make it an amazing addition to any garden.
